prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat bottom and a curved top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of 0, 0, 0. For the sketch, create a new face and add three straight lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.75, 0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0], End Point [0.75, 0.0652] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0652], End Point [0, 0.0652] - Line 4: Start Point [0, 0.0652], End Point [0, 0] Add two circles to complete the sketch: - Circle 1: Center [0.0301, 0.0351], Radius 0.0156 - Circle 2: Center [0.7199, 0.0351], Radius 0.0156 Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by specifying the euler angles [-90, 0, -90] and a translation vector of [0.375, 0, 0]. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.0903 towards the normal direction and a depth of 0.0257 in the opposite direction. This creates a new body. Part 2: Create a small triangular pillar. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of -90, 0, -90 and a translation vector of [0.375, 0, 0]. For the sketch, create a new face and add three straight lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.0753, 0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0753, 0], End Point [0, 0.0753] - Line 3: Start Point [0, 0.0753], End Point [0, 0] Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.0753. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by specifying the euler angles of the first part ([-90, 0, -90]) and a translation vector of [0.375, 0, 0]. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.0257 towards the normal direction and 0.0257 in the opposite direction, resulting in the removal of material from the first part. Final shape: The final shape is a rectangular prism with a rounded top and a flat bottom, and a hole in the center of the top face. The overall length and width are 0.75, and the height is 0.0903. There are two parts assembled to form the hole, with a length of 0.0514, and a width and height of 0.0753.</description>
